result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonte Terrell Bolden

defendant.name: Bolden, Deonte Terrell
defendant.address: 5724 West Forest Home Aveenue Apt 5, Milwaukee, WI 53220

records.addlTxt: Due to defendant's compliance with the terms of the DPA, court canceled the midpoint review hearing. Court scheduled the final review hearing with parties.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea

Defendant Deonte Terrell Bolden in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled.  Review hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Deonte Terrell Bolden in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deonte Terrell Bolden appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. Due to technical difficulties, Court stopped the proceedings and case will be heard in-person at a later date.
Case adjourned.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea
Early Intervention Deferred Prosecution Agreement, received and filed

Defendant Deonte Terrell Bolden in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deonte Terrell Bolden appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
All parties appear via zoom.  Status Conference held.  Parties advise this matter to resolve as a DPA.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonte Terrell Bolden in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for status. Defense counsel advises the Court he was recently appointed and does not have an offer. State advises this case could resolve with a DPA. 
Court orders matter adjourned for a status.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deonte Terrell Bolden in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deonte Terrell Bolden appeared by video means.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defendant appears without counsel.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Gary Rosenthal to represent the defendant; counsel to be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $75.00 per month beginning on 07/01/2022  and then the 1st of each month there after.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment, subject to tax intercept. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deonte Terrell Bolden in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/28/22 @ 2p
